inclusion.criterion: histologically proven supratentorial anaplastic oligodendrogliomas, anaplastic mixed oligoastrocytomas anaplastic astrocytomas or glioblastoma multiforme
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: unequivocal evidence for tumor recurrence or progression by MRI scan performed within 14 days prior to enrollment or documented recurrence by tumor resection
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: MRI showed a spinal cord conus mass which was biopsied and found to be anaplastic astrocytoma

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: therapy included field radiation t10-l1 followed by 11 cycles of temozolomide

inclusion.criterion: baseline on-study MRI is performed within 14 days of enrollment and on a steroid dosage that has been stable
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Karnofsky performance status of equal to or greater than 60
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: none (implied by patient's ability to walk and communicate)

inclusion.criterion: adequate bone marrow function, adequate liver function, and adequate renal function prior to starting therapy
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: history of any other cancer (except non-melanoma skin cancer or carcinoma in-situ of the cervix)
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger

exclusion.criterion: active infection, disease that will obscure toxicity or dangerously alter drug metabolism, serious intercurrent medical illness, acute or chronic pulmonary disease, pulmonary embolus, hypertension, diabetes, metabolic syndrome, stroke, heart disease, myocardial infarction, angina, coronary angioplasty, congestive heart failure, or coronary bypass surgery
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: uncontrolled hypertension (i.e. ->135/>85 mm Hg) on three repeated measurements during the 6 weeks prior to enrollment on the study
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger

notes: Patient's history of anaplastic astrocytoma and treatment with radiation and temozolomide suggest eligibility. However, patient's liver function and renal function are unknown.
